medical_history.chief_complaint: Vertigo, left-sided weakness, and a mass in the brain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual state of health until 3 days before admission, when she suddenly experienced a sensation of the room spinning, accompanied by nausea and an unsteady gait. These symptoms lasted approximately 4 hours before she sought medical attention. During her time in the emergency department, her condition worsened, leading to sudden numbness and weakness in the left arm. She subsequently experienced pain in the left thigh and involuntary movements of the left leg, which lasted for 25 minutes and resolved with intravenous lorazepam.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recent diagnosis of endometriosis; dental procedure performed 9 days before presentation due to periodontal abscesses; long history of anemia and suspected thalassemia; numerous episodes of epistaxis since childhood.
medical_history.family_history: Father had congenital heart disease and valve replacement at age 45; one brother has cardiac valvular disease; mother, other siblings, and children are well. No known similar problems in immediate family.
medical_history.social_history: Works in an office, is married, and lives with her husband and four children. Does not smoke, consume alcohol, or use illicit drugs. Has not traveled recently.
